pullRequest.title: send push to deck app, if installed
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky tobias@kaminsky.me
Testing
Writing tests is very important. Please try to write some tests for your PR.
If you need help, please do not hesitate to ask in this PR for help.
unit tests
instrumented tests
UI tests

 Tests written, or not not needed

nodes.bodyText: I am not sure if we want do make this all constants, @AndyScherzinger ?
Please have this as a separate class and file.
Can you add GPL3+ header for all new files?

Ok, so this is agood start, but we'd like to further massage it into shape.
First, "handle" means nothing, so this interface is not better than a Runnable.
It says that it "handles" something, but it the code is a factory... it doesn't make sense for me.
Lets start with the following questions:

what is the business goal of this module?
let's put a javadoc that explains what we use it for

Once we have those 2 established, we can think about a better structure.
I'm guessing - from the PR title - that the proper API would sound something like sendPushToDeck().

This method throws 2 checked exception, making it cumbersome to use. If you really need to handle excepton, please use 1 type.
But honestly I'd not throw anything. People don't know how to handle them. I'd consider using com.nextcloud.java.util.Optional instead.

We still have a bunch of deck related logic in a wrong place. Also, I have no idea what it does.
Pleae bear in mind that this Job will be deleted.
Please remove this - we don't need to spam logs.
If it does not fit in 120 chars, plese wrap paramater
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,27 @@ +package com.nextcloud.client.integration.deck; + +import android.app.PendingIntent; + +import com.nextcloud.client.account.User; +import com.nextcloud.java.util.Optional; +import com.owncloud.android.lib.resources.notifications.models.Notification; + +import androidx.annotation.NonNull; + +/** + * This API is for an integration with the Nextcloud + * Deck app for android. + */ +public interface DeckApi { + + /** + * Creates a PendingIntent that can be used in a NotificationBuilder to start the Deck app + * + * @param notification Notification object that should be processed + * @param user The user that is affected by the notification + * @return Optional with a PendingIntent or an empty Optional if the notification is not from the + * Deck server app. + */ + @NonNull + Optional createForwardToDeckActionIntent(@NonNull final Notification notification, @NonNull final User user);

nodes.bodyText:
This log stanza should be removed.

we don't need to spam logs with this information, at least not at info level
We have our own logger that can be accessed by Log_OC helper or (better) Logger interface.

The diagram tells that it passes account and some kind of "event". Can we clarify what this API is doing exactly? My posposal (after consulting the source code): Suggested change /** * Creates a PendingIntent that can be used in a NotificationBuilder to start the Deck app * * @param notification Notification object that should be processed * @param user The user that is affected by the notification * @return Optional with a PendingIntent or an empty Optional if the notification is not from the * Deck server app. */ /** * Creates a PendingIntent that can be used in a NotificationBuilder to open the notification link in Deck app * @see Deck Server App - https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/deck * * @param notification Notification that could be forwarded to Deck * @param user The user that is affected by the notification * @return If notification can be consumed by Deck, a PendingIntent openinig notification link in Deck app; empty value otherwise */

nodes.bodyText: Issue found: Avoid unused private fields such as 'TAG'.
nodes.diffHunk:

commit.message:
Move Deck integration logic to own package

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

Move Deck exception classes into own files

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

Added default serialVersionUID for new Exception classes

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

Don't instantiate intent each time in the for loop

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

Use Optional for DeckIntegration and better name for interface

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

Rename interface and implementation for Deck integration

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

Add license header and code format

https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-deck/issues/208

DeckApi unit test

Signed-off-by: Chris Narkiewicz <hello@ezaquarii.com>
